metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4720 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Email::Address module before 1.904 for Perl uses an inefficient regular expression, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via vectors related to "backtracking into the phrase," a different vulnerability than CVE-2014-0477.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4720` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libemail-address-perl - 1.905-2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libemail-address-perl package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.905-2').
